business.headline: What's driving the 6% rise in office rentals across India's major cities?Average monthly office rentals increased from Rs 85 per sq. ft. in the first nine months of 2024 to Rs 90 per sq. ft. in the same period of 2025. Bengaluru saw the sharpest rise of about 9%, followed by steady gains in cities like Pune and Delhi-NCR.

Indian refiners halt new Russian oil deals, await clarity amid sanctions: ReportLast week, the US imposed new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil producers, Lukoil and Rosneft, expanding restrictions already in place from the European Union and the UK over the war in Ukraine. The fresh measures have forced Indian buyers to reassess supply routes and payment mechanisms.

Peyush Bansal's Lenskart IPO opens on October 31. Here's all you need to knowPeyush Bansal-led Lenskart is set to hit the primary market on October 31 with its Rs 7,278 crore IPO. Backed by a strong brand presence and rapid expansion, the issue is among the most awaited listings of 2025.

6 hidden home loan traps your bank won't tell you. Expert shares smart hacksBuying your dream home can quickly turn stressful when hidden costs and surprise clauses appear. From processing fees to "mandatory" insurance, a tax expert shares six practical hacks every borrower should know before signing their home loan papers.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Why quitting SIPs within 3 years is a costly mistakeStarting an SIP is easy, staying invested isn't. An expert explains why most Indian investors quit too soon, and how this one mistake can cost them lakhs in the long run.

MCX glitch halts gold, silver futures trade; check latest updateIn a series of updates issued throughout the morning, MCX stated that the issue was being addressed and that trading would now commence from its Disaster Recovery (DR) site. However, the exchange did not specify a fresh start time.

Vodafone Idea share price: What are analysts saying after AGR ruling?Analysts see fresh hope for Vodafone Idea after the AGR ruling, with Motilal Oswal, Emkay, and Citi turning positive on the stock and projecting scope for further upside.

Amazon's biggest-ever layoffs: Why 30,000 jobs are on the lineThe layoffs will affect nearly 10% of Amazon's 350,000 corporate employees, though that's only a fraction of its 1.55 million total workforce.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid profit booking; PSU banks in focus on FDI cap buzzAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading 66.76 points higher at 84,845.60, while the NSE Nifty50 edged up 14.25 points to 25,980.30.

Paramount to cut 1,000 jobs ahead of merger with Warner BrosThe job cuts, which follow the $8.4 billion merger between Skydance Media and Paramount Global, would impact roughly 5% of Paramount's employees based on its workforce prior to the completion of the deal.

Gold price at Rs 1.21 lakh, silver dips sharply: More correction ahead?According to analysts, the dip was both expected and healthy after gold prices shot up from nearly Rs 75,000 to Rs 1.30 lakh in just a few months. A correction of about 10–15% was on the cards, which would bring prices closer to Rs 1.15 lakh per 10 grams.

Amazon to target 30,000 corporate workers in largest ever job cuts: ReportAmazon will lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees starting Tuesday, its biggest round of cuts since 2022, as the tech giant trims costs and corrects pandemic-era overhiring across divisions.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

How credit cards fuelled India's Diwali shopping partyA new survey has revealed how Indians turned to credit cards for high-value festive buys this Diwali, planning purchases smartly around cashback offers, no-cost EMIs and online deals.

Gold, silver prices are falling. Should you buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are slipping as global optimism rises and profit-taking kicks in. Experts explain what's driving the fall and whether buyers should wait before investing.

Hospital bills are rising. Here's how to make your health insurance smarterAs medical inflation pushes treatment and hospital costs higher, insurers are reworking pricing and policies. Here's how flexible plans, wellness incentives, and smart choices can help you keep your cover affordable.

Supreme Court allows Centre to reconsider Vodafone Idea's plea on extra AGR duesFor Vodafone Idea, which is already burdened with mounting liabilities and ongoing financial strain, the top court's nod gives the Centre scope to reassess the dues, potentially opening a narrow path for relief or renegotiation.

Why modern parents are building 'Gold Vaults' instead of buying jewelleryParents are rethinking how they gift gold, moving beyond jewellery to create long-term "Gold Vaults" for their children. Here's how this modern plan turns tradition into a smart, inflation-proof investment.

Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At 10:33 am, the NSE Nifty50 surged 171.25 points to 25,966.40, while the BSE Sensex jumped 575.03 points to 84,786.91. Broader market indices also traded higher, mirroring the upbeat sentiment on Dalal Street.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Khan, Urmila Mantondkar's Rangeela to hit theatres again on this date Marking three decades since its original premiere, the 1995 Bollywood classic film 'Rangeela' will be re-released. The movie will hit theatres on  November 28 in a new 4K HD restored version.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 50: Evicted contestants' return sparks major drama Evicted contestants made a dramatic comeback in 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9', shaking up the nomination process with emotional confrontations, unexpected alliances, and shocking betrayals.

Rupali Ganguly is all hearts and tears over Amul's tribute to her kaka Satish Shah Amul has honoured late actor Satish Shah with a special tribute campaign, recognising his decades-long contribution to Indian entertainment after his recent passing. The gesture drew responses from industry colleagues, including Rupali Ganguly.

Baseer Ali: Hurt that Nehal used me in Bigg Boss 19; still under contract After his eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19', Baseer Ali opened up about feeling sidelined by the makers, claiming he received no feedback while others were guided. In an exclusive chat with India Today, he addressed his bond with Nehal Chudasama and Farrhana Bhatt.

Bigg Boss 19: Did Nehal and Baseer's on-screen equation kill their chances Nehal Chudasama and Baseer Ali's unexpected double eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19' left fans shocked, especially since Baseer was considered a strong contender. Their growing on-screen bond, seen by many as a strategic friendship, may have backfired and cost both their place in the game.

Farah Khan compares Diana Penty's heritage home to SRK's Mannat Filmmaker Farah Khan recently visited actor Diana Penty's heritage house in Mumbai. Amazed by its history and grandeur, she compared the 'Cocktail' actor's home to Shah Rukh Khan's house Mannat.

The Family Man 3 release date: Manoj Bajpayee back with new threats, higher stakes The makers of 'The Family Man' announced the return of Manoj Bajpayee in Season 3, with a global release this year. The new season features an expanded cast, fresh adversaries, and promises a mix of action, suspense, and humour.

Prabhas's Fauzi role inspired by Arjuna, Karna, Ekalavya: Director Hanu Raghavapudi Director Hanu Raghavapudi has shed light on Prabhas's character in 'Fauzi', revealing a portrayal inspired by mythological figures. The film, produced by Mythri Movie Makers, marks Prabhas's return to epic period dramas and promises to blend heroism, sacrifice, and devotion in a 1940s colonial setting.

Music composer Sachin Sanghvi sexual assault case: Lawyer urges media sensitivity Music composer Sachin Sanghvi's advocate called for sensitivity from the media as legal proceedings continue and investigation remains active in the sexual assault case.

India's Srijit Mukherji directs film on Sherlock Holmes creator Arthur Conan Doyle The feature film is titled 'Elementary, My Dear Holmes'. Details on the cast and when the shoot will begin are yet to be officially revealed.

Karan Johar celebrates 9 years of Ae Dil Hai Mushkil with unseen photos Filmmaker Karan Johar has described 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil' as the most personal film he has ever made. Marking nearly a decade since its release, Johar shared his thoughts and gratitude for the film's journey and the people involved.

Kim Ga Eun, Yoon Sun Woo wed in Seoul with King the Land stars in attendance After a decade-long relationship, Kim Ga Eun and Yoon Sun Woo have married in a ceremony in Seoul, with family and industry friends in attendance.

Dude actor Pradeep Ranganathan scores Rs 100-crore hat-trick, expresses gratitude Actor-director Pradeep Ranganathan thanked fans following the success of 'Dude', marking his third consecutive film to cross Rs 100 crore at the global box office.

I am not for sale: Shashi Tharoor defends his praise for Aryan Khan's debut show Congress leader Shashi Tharoor addressed claims of a 'paid review' following his positive remarks about Aryan Khan's web series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Nysa and Orry recreate Kajol and Rekha's 1996 photoshoot for Halloween 2025 Ahead of Halloween 2025, Nysa Devgan and Orry collaborated to recreate an old photoshoot of Kajol and Rekha. Several celebrities and social media users have praised the duo online.

Salman Khan-Govinda to partner again after 18 years for a new film: Report Salman Khan and Govinda are set to reunite on screen after nearly two decades, confirming reports of a new untitled project in the works.

25 years of Mohabbatein: The film's debate of love vs discipline still rages on Twenty-five years on, Yash Raj's 'Mohabbatein' still reminds us that love can be the greatest act of rebellion. The violins may have faded, but their echoes of defiance remain timeless. And of course, Shah Rukh Khan remains evergreen.

Ajith Kumar asks fans to keep quiet as they yell 'Thala' at Tirupati temple. Watch Actor Ajith Kumar visited the Tirumala Tirupati temple and requested fans to maintain silence. His respectful behaviour highlights his humility despite fan excitement.

BB 19: Nehal Chudasama on Farrhana Bhatt, truth of situationship with Baseer Ali 'Bigg Boss 19' evicted contestant Nehal Chudasama called the outside narrative about her a "devastating shocker." In an exclusive chat, she cleared the air on her bond with Farrhana Bhatt, her alleged situationship with Baseer Ali.

general news.headline: Cloud seeding conducted in parts of Delhi, artificial rain likely soonThe first full-scale cloud seeding trial has taken place in Delhi to tackle severe post-Diwali smog. The success of the effort could significantly lower the city's hazardous air pollution levels.

Indian refiners halt new Russian oil deals, await clarity amid sanctions: ReportLast week, the US imposed new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil producers, Lukoil and Rosneft, expanding restrictions already in place from the European Union and the UK over the war in Ukraine. The fresh measures have forced Indian buyers to reassess supply routes and payment mechanisms.

Pakistan allowing a foreign country to conduct drone strikes on Afghanistan?A bombshell revelation has emerged in the Afghanistan-Pakistan peace talks in Turkey. Pakistan, for the first time, has admitted that it cannot prevent drone strikes inside Afghanistan due to a secret agreement with a foreign country. This comes just months after Islamabad began strengthening defence and strategic ties with the US, amid President Donald Trump's forceful public demand for the return of Bagram airbase.

Setback for Karnataka, High Court halts order seen as targeting RSS activitiesThe Karnataka High Court's Dharwad Bench stayed the state government's order mandating private organisations to seek prior permission to hold events in government premises, an order seen as targeting RSS activities.

Plane flies into Hurricane Melissa, goosebump-inducing video reveals nature's mightThe stunning footage was captured by a US Air Force crew, known as "Hurricane Hunters." They flew directly into the eye of the Category 5 storm scheduled to make landfall in Jamaica as the strongest to hit the island since record-keeping began in 1851.

Cyclone Montha Live: Flights cancelled, rain lashes Andhra coast as storm nears landfallCyclone Montha Live Updates: As Cyclone Montha is expected to make landfall today, Andhra Pradesh and Odisha were placed on high alert, triggering precautionary evacuations and post-landfall preparations. Weather authorities have warned of rough sea conditions along the Andhra coast from Nellore to Srikakulam, with waves likely to rise between 2 and 4.7 metres as the system intensifies into a cyclonic storm on Tuesday morning. Most parts of coastal Andhra Pradesh is forecast to receive light to moderate rainfall, with heavy to very heavy showers in some areas and extremely heavy rainfall at isolated locations between October 27 and 29. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

As India shuts a door, Pakistan opens a port for BangladeshAmid strained ties between India and Bangladesh, Pakistan has moved swiftly to seize the opportunity and offered Dhaka the use of its Karachi port. The timing of the move is crucial, coming weeks after India banned import of jute products.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

The Family Man 3 release date: Manoj Bajpayee back with new threats, higher stakesThe makers of 'The Family Man' announced the return of Manoj Bajpayee in Season 3, with a global release this year. The new season features an expanded cast, fresh adversaries, and promises a mix of action, suspense, and humour.

Pak violates ceasefire in J&K's Leepa valley, opens fire on Army postsThe Line of Control has been quiet since May 10, when Pakistan reached out to India for a ceasefire following three days of hostilities. Sources said Pakistan violated the truce on the intervening night of October 26-27.

Prashant Kishor enrolled as voter in 2 states, stirs row before Bihar pollsIn Bengal, Prashant Kishor is registered as a voter in the Bhabanipur Assembly constituency, whose sitting MLA is Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

Viral: BJP MLA slips, falls into Yamuna while filming reel to prove river is cleanThe incident caught on camera shows Patparganj MLA Ravinder Singh Negi slipping and falling into the Yamuna, as a political blame game continues over the river's cleanliness amid the Chhath Puja celebrations.

Amazon's biggest-ever layoffs: Why 30,000 jobs are on the lineThe layoffs will affect nearly 10% of Amazon's 350,000 corporate employees, though that's only a fraction of its 1.55 million total workforce.

In a 1st, civil aircraft to be produced in India as HAL partners with RussiaHAL said that the SJ-100, a narrow-body aircraft, would be a 'game changer' for short-haul connectivity under the Modi government's UDAN scheme.

Meet Galaxy Z TriFold, first triple-folding smartphone from SamsungSamsung has reportedly revealed its first-ever triple-folding phone, the Galaxy Z Trifold, at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) CEO Summit. The device has a tablet-like screen when unfolded, and a more conventional outer display.

Video: Transit bus catches fire near Air India plane at Delhi airport's Terminal 3According to officials, fire tenders, local police, and other concerned agencies, including CISF, immediately responded to the incident. The fire was quickly doused, and no injuries have been reported.

Is US going to invade Venezuela? 3 reasons behind Trump's troops buildupThe military build-up and authorisation to the CIA for ops inside Venezuela indicate imminent action by the Trump administration, which has accused the Maduro regime of trafficking drugs into the US. But experts say that the real reason isn't drugs and American troops might not actually invade Venezuela.

Used ChatGPT: People fact-check Pakistan's Shehbaz Sharif on KashmirPakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif's absurd claim about Kashmir joining the Indian Union was quickly flagged as historically inaccurate by people on X. The post sparked a wave of corrections, memes, and expert commentary, where a person flagged over 70% Generative-AI content in the post.

Zoho's Sridhar Vembu and the perils of pseudo-science: No, vaccines don't cause autismWhen a billionaire entrepreneur starts talking like a vaccine sceptic, the harm goes far beyond a social media post. Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu's recent claim that India's sharp rise in autism is linked to "too many childhood vaccines" is more than just misinformed; it's reckless

Who was Rani Abbakka? The 16th-century queen who led India's first naval warQueen Abbakka of Ullal led a formidable naval defence against Portuguese colonial forces in the 16th century. Her strategic alliances and guerrilla tactics made her a legendary symbol of resistance in coastal Karnataka.

Emotional vs physical cheating: Which hurts more? Relationship experts answerWe took the 'emotional cheating vs physical cheating' question to relationship experts. And it turns out, one of them might just be the bigger troublemaker.

UPSC aspirant murder case: Forensics student Amrita was disowned by family in 2024The disclosure adds a new twist to the murder of UPSC aspirant Ramkesh Meena, whose charred body was found earlier this month inside a burnt apartment in north Delhi's Gandhi Vihar.

Cyclone Montha intensifies as it barrels towards Andhra, landfall tonightCyclone Montha is intensifying over the Bay of Bengal, threatening Andhra Pradesh and Odisha with severe winds and heavy rain. The states are rushing evacuations ahead of the landfall expected later this evening.

Kolkata woman alleges molestation, names Park Street gang-rape convict in FIRThe incident allegedly took place on the night of October 26 when the complainant was partying with her husband, brother, and friends. According to her complaint, a group of men began arguing with her group before turning violent.

sports.headline: India not only ancient home, but modern powerhouse of chess: FIDE President FIDE President Arkady Dvorkovich praised India as not only the ancient home of chess but as a modern powerhouse as well. The FIDE World Cup returns to India for the first time since 2002.

Are Australia prepared to counter Abhishek Sharma's mayhem? Mitchell Marsh reveals Australia captain Mitchell Marsh says his team is ready to face India's aggressive batter Abhishek Sharma in the upcoming T20I series. Abhishek is the current number-one T20I batter in the world and was recently adjudged Player of the Tournament in Asia Cup 2025.

Real Madrid let off Vinicius Jr. after El Clasico substitution meltdown: Report Real Madrid has reportedly decided not to punish Vinicius Jr. for his emotional outburst during El Clasico, viewing the situation as an internal matter.

Shreyas Iyer Cheats Death: Out of ICU After Spleen Laceration Scare in Sydney This special report focuses on the health of Indian ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer following a severe injury in Sydney. Iyer suffered a lacerated spleen during the third ODI against Australia, leading to internal bleeding and admission to an ICU. BCCI Vice President Rajiv Shukla told India Today that 'everything is fine, he's medically stable. But he'll be there for seven or eight days more in the hospital.' Iyer sustained the impact injury after taking a diving catch and was immediately hospitalised after showing signs of extreme distress in the dressing room. Medical experts have described spleen injuries as potentially life-threatening. While Iyer is now out of the ICU and in a general ward, his participation in the upcoming home series against South Africa is in doubt.

I've been working really hard, runs will come eventually: Suryakumar Yadav India T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has said that he's been working hard behind the scenes to regain his form ahead of the five-match T20I series against Australia. Ever since being appointed the team's full-time captain in July 2024, Suryakumar has scored 330 runs from 20 innings at an average of 18.33 with two fifties to his name.

India rule ICC, was told not to fine them for slow over-rate: Ex-match referee Former match referee Chris Broad has alleged the the Indian cricketing lobby rules the International Cricket Council. Speaking to the Telegraph Broad made several revelations from his officiating days.

Australia will have doubts facing India in semi final, they're beatable: Mithali Mithali Raj believes Australia has doubts about facing India in the 2025 Women's World Cup semi final. India face immense pressure as hosts to defeat the unbeaten defending champions in Navi Mumbai.

Fearless Abhishek Sharma will put Hazlewood out of form, says Abhishek Nayar If Abhishek Sharma is in form, he will take down Josh Hazlewood, feels former India batting coach Abhishek Nayar. Abhishek is coming off a tremendous run in Asia Cup 2025.

Shreyas Iyer stable, replying to texts: Suryakumar says batter out of danger Shreyas Iyer is stable after his serious injury at the Sydney Cricket Ground. India captain Suryakumar Yadav provided the latest update on Iyer and said that he was replying to the text messages from teammates.

Harshit Rana wins over critics, shows Gambhir's backing paid off Harshit Rana silenced critics with a four-wicket spell in Sydney, turning doubters like Kris Srikkanth into admirers. Backed by Gautam Gambhir, the 23-year-old pacer proved he belongs, blending aggression with control to mark his arrival on the big stage.

Lamine Yamal's El Clasico lesson: Talk is cheap, and football is beyond one season Lamine Yamal went from being Europe's breakout star in Spain's Euro 2024 and Barcelona's treble triumph to becoming a headline magnet for all the wrong reasons. The 18-year-old's personal controversies now threaten to overshadow his brilliance.

Free from Ro-Ko shadow, can Shubman Gill stake his claim in T20I side?Free from the Ro-Ko shadow, Shubman Gill will now have the task of getting his spot fixed in the T20I side for India. With some key lessons from the Asia Cup and the pressure from competition, can Gill nail down his place?

BAN vs WI: Hope, Powell and bowlers star as West Indies win 1st T20I by 16 runsWest Indies started their T20I series against Bangladesh with a convincing 16-run win on Monday, October 27. Shai Hope and Rovman Powell starred with the bat while the bowlers put the squeeze on the hosts to secure the victory.

Shreyas Iyer's spleen injury decoded: The risks, recovery and what comes nextShreyas Iyer's spleen injury, sustained during the Sydney ODI, has raised concern among fans. Here's what a splenic laceration means, how it's treated, and what his road to recovery could look like as doctors monitor his progress closely in Sydney.

Juventus sack Igor Tudor after winless run, appoint Brambilla as interim coachJuventus have dismissed head coach Igor Tudor following a series of poor results. The club hopes interim coach Massimo Brambilla can reverse the team's fortunes amid growing pressure.

BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla wishes Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after spleen injuryBCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla wished Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after the batter suffered a laceration to his spleen while taking a stunning catch in the third ODI against Australia. The BCCI confirmed he is medically stable and recovering in Sydney.

Women's World Cup: Shafali Verma replaces injured Pratika Rawal before semifinalThe Indian team has added Shafali Verma to the squad after she was approved as the replacement for Pratika Rawal on Monday, October 27.

Suryakumar's form not a concern, okay to fail when fearless: Gautam GambhirIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir is not concerned about Suryakumar Yadav's poor run in international cricket. Gambhir said that it was okay to fail while playing fearless cricket.

Mourinho has the last laugh: Turkey moves to punish 371 referees in betting scandalTurkey's football federation has disciplined 371 referees for betting violations. This scandal highlights deep-rooted corruption and raises questions about football governance in Turkey.

Watch: Rohit Sharma returns to Mumbai in style to chorus of Hitman chantsRohit Sharma got a hero's welcome as he returned to Mumbai after his fine performance in the Australia series. Rohit scored a hundred and a fifty during the ODI series down under.

Usman Khawaja backs Marnus Labuschagne, tips Renshaw to make comebackUsman Khawaja backed Marnus Labuschagne to be part of the Australia team and tipped his Queensland opening partner Matt Renshaw to make a return the side for the Ashes. Australia are looking to find a partner for Khawaja at the top of the order.

Who replaces Pratika Rawal? Ex-cricketers weigh in ahead of Australia semisIndia's opening batter Pratika Rawal is ruled out of the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final due to injury. The team faces a critical selection decision that could impact their chances against Australia.

Beating stigma: Kannagi Nagar's Karthika shines with Kabaddi goldHailing from Kannagi Nagar, Karthika has made the whole Tamil Nadu proud with her performance as the vice-captain of the U-18 women's kabaddi team during the youth Asian Games. India clinched gold in women's kabaddi with Karthika playing a big role in the win.

Vinicius's Clasico meltdown: Should Xabi be worried about his Real Madrid exit?Vinicius Jr's fiery El Clasico debut ended in drama as he reportedly threatened to leave after being subbed off. Xabi Alonso, however, remained unfazed, keeping his focus firmly on Real Madrid's win.

Rohit Sharma 3.0: Fitter at 38, ready to run marathons againIn Australia, Rohit Sharma showed that he was ready to grind it out to secure a place for the 2027 ODI World Cup. At 38, is Rohit once again ready to return to his old role of an accumulator?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
